dublin_core.dcvalue: The purpose of this systematic review was to synthesize current evidence regarding nonpharmacological approaches to heart failure HF management Following a literature search identified studies were coded using the Heart Failure Study Assessment Scale HFSAS developed by the authors Results included high quality ratings a predominance of multidisciplinary disease management studies decreased readmission rates and some improvement in quality of life Implications for practice leadership education and research are described
Nonpharmacological strategies for improving heart failure outcomes in the community: a systematic review.
